events.message: The insured filed a claim after the vehicle was involved in a rear-end collision on the highway causing moderate damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident due to keywords relating to car collision and vehicle damage.
An agent was promptly assigned to assist the customer with the auto accident claim and guide them through the process.
The insurance company formally acknowledged receipt of the claim regarding the vehicle accident and assured support.
The insurer requested police reports, photos of the damaged car, and the driver's statement for further investigation.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including accident photographs, the police report, and repair estimates.
Investigation began to assess fault, damage extent, and verify all claim details related to the car collision event.
The investigation confirmed the claimant was not at fault, and damage estimates were verified as valid.
The insurer proposed a fair settlement covering all repair costs and rental car reimbursement during vehicle repairs.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the settlement offer and appreciation for the prompt communication.
The claim was formally approved for payment based on the investigation outcomes and agreed settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the claimant's designated bank account covering all approved costs for vehicle repairs.
The insurance claim was closed after full settlement payment and customer confirmation of completed repairs.
The case file was archived in the system for future reference and record-keeping purposes.
